subject: Re: testXXXX must return void?
msgSnippet: Do you see the difference between that example and my example? He s talking about hacking production data with a bunch of crummy one-off code, I was talking
messageBody:
Do you see the difference between that example and my example? He's
talking about hacking production data with a bunch of crummy one-off
code, I was talking about using inspectors in a pure development
mode. If you dont believe in that, there's nothing I can say.


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> Start here:
http://www.xprogramming.com/Practices/PracDoInInspector.htm
>
> If you've never read this before, then it may help you understand
our perspective.
>
> >So said areider on 2003-06-24 --------------------
> >--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Robert Wenner <robert@p...> wrote:
> >> I am not sure if I got you right here.
> >> Why do you use that inspector? To /manually/ verify
the /automated/
> >> test did not fail? Collecting test results (whether tests fail
or
> >pass) is JUnit's job, not the tester's -- that's why it is an
> >automated test.
> >
> >I think we are coming from different places. Maybe its my
Smalltalk
> >background. I dont want to get too OT but maybe a specific example
> >will help.
> <snip />
>
>
> J. B. Rainsberger,
